IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Forestdale, Inc. provides services to children in the metropolitan new york area, including foster boarding homes, preparing youth for adulthood and preventive care.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Forestdale's mission is to protect, nurture, and strengthen families with children by supporting every family member in meeting life's challenges.
IRS990.Description: Foster care services - help families heal in an environment that is peaceful and inviting. Each year we work with more than 500 children who are in temporary foster homes, with the goal to reunite them with family members whenever possible. We are dedicated to giving birth parents the help and support they need to reclaim a permanent place in their children's lives. The department is comprised of five distinct programs: Foster Boarding Home, Foster Boarding Homes (RIP), Medicaid, Preparing Youth for Adulthood and Foster Parent Support. Foster Boarding home expenses cover children's living costs, foster parent recruitment and stipends, and caseworker salaries, among other expenses. Medicaid pays for children's medical and mental health needs. Preparing Youth for Adulthood helps young people ages 14 to 21 develop the personal resilience and social resources they need to thrive outisde foster care.

Activity2.Description: Preventive Services - help highly stressed families address challenges before they escalate into full-blown crises. The goal of Preventive Services is to help families avoid the foster care system and connect parents and children with the resources they need to thrive. Preventive caseworkers help families identify and address issues that impact their ability to be intimate and supportive of each other, from chronic unemployment to educational neglect to domestic violence. Families typically receive one year of services under the Preventive program; Forestdale works with up to 75 families at any given time.

Activity3.Description: forestdale fathering initiative - provides counseling, parenting skill classes and assistance to find educational and job training programs to non-custodial fathers. the program serviced 250 fathers to better manage their lives and reconnect with their children.

ActivityOther.Description: Other program services include Preparing Youth for adulthood, Infant Mortality Reduction program,Community Partnership initiative, and Teenage Services program.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The endowment funds are used to provide support for program operations and capital improvements.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FORESTDALE RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT OF BEING SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT FORESTDALE HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION. FORESTDALE IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO AUDITS BY APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR TAX PERIODS PRIOR TO 2006.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Part I -1b The board and the Executive Director were involved in the decision making process to determine maximum discretionary expenses.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Forestdale, Inc. has its Form 990 prepared by an outside accounting firm and has established the following review process to ensure that the information reported is complete and accurate. When the Form 990 has been prepared, reviewed by management and is ready to be filed with the Internal Revenue Service, it's submitted electronically to members of the organization's governing body for any comments prior to its submission. The governing body is provided with one week to review the prepared Form 990 and provide their comments. Any comments are then grouped, summarized and provided to the director of finance, who is in charge of filing the return. Each issue is documented and addressed until the return is finalized and approved for filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: forestdale, Inc. currently has in place a conflict of interest policy which it annually monitors and enforces. The board currently mandates that all members of management and the governing body annually sign a conflict of interest policy and disclose any potential or actual conflicts that may exist. The signed conflict of interest policy is kept on file and board members may not vote on an issue on which they have a conflict.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive director's and other officers and key employees'compensation is evaluated annually upon review of the following criteria: -Industry Standard (COFFCCA Annual executive compensation survey, independent compensation consultant, Administration for Children's Services' compensation survey) -Review by board of directors,specifically the board head of compensation (Executive Director only) -accomplishment of per-set goals -all decisions made regarding compensation are included in the board minutes.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Forestdale, Inc. makes its Form 990 available for public inspection as required under section 6104 of the Internal Revenue Code on guidestar.org and other similar types of websites. In addition, Forms 990 and 1023 as well as the financial statements AND conflict of interest policy are available upon written request at 67-35 112th street, Forest Hills, NY 11375 or by calling the organization directly at (718) 263-0740.

FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 2C: FORESTDALE, INC. HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
